questions.question: ………………….. on tip-toes, she reached for the mango.
questions.description: She stood on tip-toes. She reached for the mango. We can combine these two sentences using the present participle.

questions.question: …………………….. hungry, the child ate the food greedily.
questions.description: The child was hungry. The child ate the food greedily. We can combine these two sentences using being. Being hungry, the child ate the food greedily.

questions.question: ……………………….. his injury, he played exceptionally well.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. It is followed by an ing form or noun.

questions.question: ……………………. injured his knee, he cannot walk.
…………………………. himself in deep debt, he lost all hope.
In the event of such a thing ………………………, I will resign.
He did not lose hope ……………………….. his repeated failures.
questions.description: All of these are possible here.

questions.question: …………………………. taking the tablet, I didn’t get any relief.
………………………. pity for the mouse, the seer turned it into a beautiful girl.
………………………….. tired, I lay down to sleep.
questions.description: I was tired. I lay down to sleep. We can combine these two sentences using being.

questions.question: …………………….. much blood, he struggled to stay awake.
